precontext: Sean had always dreamt of working by the sea. His job at the harbor kept him busy, overseeing shipments and coordinating arrivals. Yesterday, a hiccup in the schedule threw everything into chaos.
sentence: Sean was docked pay as soon as he arrived late yesterday.
meanings_considered: deprive someone of benefits, as a penalty
explanation:
• The precontext describes Sean working at the harbor, overseeing shipments and coordinating arrivals, which strongly suggests a connection to maritime operations.  
• "Docked pay" as a penalty fits naturally with the context of a schedule hiccup and a late arrival, implying disciplinary action.  
• "Come into dock" would refer to a ship arriving, which is unrelated to Sean’s personal situation and does not align with the idea of being paid less.
clear_meaning_text: deprive someone of benefits, as a penalty
